title: The problem with URF
body:
Supply and demand.

---

Also all these people spamming who can't spell for shit.

You know who you are.

Edit: Just for the record, I'm not entirely against urf, but I don't think bringing it back will do any good. That being said, I will still play the fuck out of it.

replies.body: i think we just all forgot that  today's not April fools for lol, that its the NA April fools day the urf will come back (i wanna know, is this the first game mode to come back to play for a second time :/)

> i wanna know, is this the first game mode to come back to play for a second tim

No. Both Hexakill and One For All have been re-released and both of them had changes (OFA became OFA: Mirror and Hexakill became Hexakill: TT) and yet people still think the original URF is going to return.

Just because  they changed the other two modes, doesn't necessary mean they won't return the original URF.
#urfnotnurf
#playpositive

Riot has made no indication that URF, as it was last year, will be returning. The fact they've modified other featured game modes that have returned tends to support that. If it is going to return it's probably not going to be soon.
I bet you're feeling pretty silly right now.
No. Why would I be?

Why downvote this!

Everybody was SPECULATING!
It's not based on fact or reason, but intuition/gut/feeling. 

Getting a speculation wrong means nothing, just like getting a speculation right means nothing.
>If it is going to return it's probably not going to be soon
And that matters because? I was only expressing an opinion.

Except other changes have not been in-game changes but out of game changes.
Hexakill was the same game on a different map.
All For One was mirrored.

They also amplify the point of the game mode:
Hexakill; more players on a smaller map = more chaos 
All For One; 10 of the same champion, this time you could get fixed up with enemies as well as allies

Bringing out NURF would be a distinctively different game.
It also seems like the opposite of URF.

Either way, it doesn't matter; I rarely play fun modes (never played URF).
But based on what's been released, I agree with the hypothesis that NURF is an April Fools joke and URF is coming back.
^ This

URF confirmed. URF is blind pick with bands. There's a 66% healing reduction that slowly ticks down.

It's fun as shit.
You're a bit late to the party mate, we've been playing since 4pm local time (3 hours ago).
Actually i'm late to the party since the last one, this is my first time in URF.

So we need more demand? 

Or less supply?

It's more about what people request in comparison to what they receive.

EDIT: I couldn't really find any other cliche to throw in there, and didn't want to explain it in a long paragraph, so I opted for supply and demand kek,

I should of added Kappa!

We have too much demand (well according to some), and no supply. 
So they were both the opposite or what they were suppose to be.

I'm really not that funny.
I should just stick to what I know.
#playpositive

> I should just stick to what I know.

You do that.

#playpositive
#neversurrender
#earntifyoulearnt
#eventhepros
#ithappens
kek
